channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Opinion: Remembering Catherine O'Hara
item.description: Actor Catherine O'Hara, famed for her comedic skill, died Friday at her home in Los Angeles following a brief illness. She was 71.

item.title: With decades-long restrictions lifted, a Pakistani brewery has started exporting beer
item.description: Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's be...

item.title: The U.S. will likely lose its measles elimination status. Here's what that means
item.description: The South Carolina measles outbreak is now bigger than last year's Texas outbreak and is happening as the U.S. is poised to lose its measles eliminati...

item.title: Israeli strikes kill 23 Palestinians as Gaza ceasefire inches forward
item.description: Hospitals in Gaza said Israeli strikes killed at least 23 Palestinians Saturday, one of the highest tolls since the October ceasefire aimed at stoppin...

item.title: A red hat, inspired by a symbol of resistance to Nazi occupation, gains traction in Minnesota
item.description: A Minneapolis knitting shop has resurrected the design of a Norwegian cap worn to protest Nazi occupation. Its owner says the money raised from hat pa...

item.title: Canada's Poilievre sweeps Conservative party leadership test with 87.4%
item.description: The opposition leader received a strong show of support from party delegates, despite the recent electoral loss against the Liberals.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (Feb. 1)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Courtney Marie Andrews performs "Everyone Wants To Feel Like You Do"
item.description: Courtney Marie Andrews started writing songs as a teenager and played in punk bands before starting out on her own. Since then, she has been nominated...

item.title: Israeli air strikes kill at least 28 Palestinians in Gaza, rescue officials say
item.description: Israel's military confirmed the strikes, which come during a ceasefire that Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaking.

item.title: Former CNN host Don Lemon charged in anti-ICE protest at Minnesota church
item.description: Lemon says he was just doing his job as a journalist reporting on the protests at the church.

item.title: Immigrant pursued by federal agents before Alex Pretti's killing speaks out
item.description: "I was there. I saw everything," Jose Huerta Chuma, who remains in hiding, told CBS News.

item.title: 10-year-old's road to recovery, 1 year after Northeast Philadelphia plane crash
item.description: Ramesses Vazquez Viana still has a long road ahead of him, but one year after the deadly Northeast Philadelphia medical jet crash, his recovery has be...

item.title: Watch: Frozen river hosts dance party in Kyiv
item.description: Residents in the Ukrainian capital are finding joy in unusual places, despite power cuts caused by Russian attacks and freezing winter temperatures.

item.title: More than 200 killed in mine collapse in DR Congo
item.description: The mine gave way after heavy rains on Wednesday, a local rebel spokesman says.
